Epinephrine.description: Administered every 3-5 minutes early in CPR (every other cycle) for asystole, ventricular fibrillation, PEA.

Vasopressin.description: As an alternative to epinephrine every 3-5 minutes (every second BLS cycle) for asystole, bradycardia, PEA.

Atropine.description: Sinus bradycardia, asystole, or PEA associated with high vagal tone.

Lidocaine.description: Pulseless ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation resistant to defibrillation.

Sodium Bicarbonate.description: Severe metabolic acidemia (pH < 7.0) associated with prolonged CPR efforts (must be adequately ventilated to be effective), hyperkalemia.
